page.title: 10The Parish Church,Sellindge
page.content: The present Parish Church of Sellindge stands on the main A20 road at the west end of the village opposite the junction with Stone Hill.Also known as the church of St.Mary the Virgin.It dates from about 1100,but the original Domesday Book records there being 2 churches.It is very likely that a Saxon church stood on this site and part of the external South wall could date from this period.Various modifications were made up to 1850 giving the present church which is about 90ft by 40ft including the tower and vestry.Much of the stained glass was damaged by bombs in 1940,but the bells survived,the oldest cast in 1723.The church comes within the Canterbury Diocese and the present (1985) Vicar is Rev.P.Goodsell,whose Parish also includes Lympne and Stowting.
